abstract: Kindle Fire tablets ship today, Chelsea Clinton becomes a correspondent for NBC News, a new magazine will cover only reality stars and other media news.
snippet: Kindle Fire tablets ship today, Chelsea Clinton becomes a correspondent for NBC News, a new magazine will cover only reality stars and other media news.
lead_paragraph: Steven Levy of Wired magazine profiles Jeff Bezos as Amazon ships its first Kindle Fire tablets today. The piece sets up Amazon vs. Apple. “Apple is fundamentally a hardware company — 91 percent of its revenue comes from sales of its coveted machines, compared to just 6 percent from iTunes,” he writes. “Amazon, on the other hand, is a content-focused company — almost half of its revenue comes from sales of media like books, music, TV shows, and movies — and the fire-sale-priced Fire is designed to be primarily a passport to the large amount of that content that’s available digitally.” [Wired]
